intro: Sagraea portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican sagraea, is a flowering plant native to the island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
